Pre-Game Insights: Indonesia and Bahrain were set to face off in a World Cup qualifier match on October 10, 2024
Key Match Events: The match went into stoppage time with Indonesia leading 2-1, but Omani referee Ahmed Al-Kaf extended the match beyond the six minutes of extra time initially indicated, allowing Bahrain to equalize in the 99th minute
Post-Match Reflections: Indonesian fans were outraged, accusing the referee of deliberate bias and manipulation, leading to accusations of corruption against Bahrain's Football Federation
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indonesia's national team manager was given a red card for his protests post-match
Others: Indonesia's Football Association (PSSI) has formally submitted a protest letter to both FIFA and the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) regarding the controversial refereeing decisions
